intro: Papaver cathcartia, commonly known as the Cathcart poppy, is a species of flowering plant in the family Papaveraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal medicine. The seeds of Papaver cathcartia are also used in some culinary applications.
